feature.label: Arduino Eclipse Extensions
feature.description: This feature allows easy creation of Arduino projects in an Eclipse environment. The main features are a new arduino sketch wizard a import library wizard a button to build the project a button to upload to the arduino board a project property page allowing to change the arduino board type and the port the arduino is using. Version 2_1_4 Support for multiple configurations Support for aternative soze command Support for extentions to the C C++ compile instructions Implementation of the eep compiler Added flag to platform.txt to skip the archiver New Arduino Icons Support for Teensy 3 Hard coded Teensy uploaded comands are now using Platform.txt Longer wait times for upload Fix for due compilation Version 2_0_0 New version for Arduino IDE 1.5.2 compatibility and without avr-eclipse This version runs with Juno Only Arduino project and sketch are in one eclipse project Fixed problems with the indexer Support for multiple boards.txt files added Support for teensy added Version 1_2_5 Cleaned up so that leonardo_test is not in the include path Sorted the list of Arduino Boards Version 1_2_4 Added Leonardo support Undid the "Fixed a bug on MAC when AVRPaths searches..) Disabled searching for paths (other fix for the above undo) Note 1_2_3 is not configurable on MAC. Version 1_2_3 Added a serial test button to test the serial library in the preference page Fixed a bug to support non arduino cores (the correct include folder is now set) Fixed a bug on MAC when AVRPaths searches for the location of G++ AvrDude and others. (no MAC search as been added but the POSIX is no longer used in case of mac) Added suport for specific c compile, c++ compile and link instructions the keys to be added to the boards.txt are [board id].build.cpp.options [board id].build.c.options [board id].build.link.options fixed the bug that when the "private library" is not selected the eclipse environment is not setup properly. If not set a error will pop up. it should not be possible to exit the preferences without setting it. Version 1_2_2 Added multiple library import Added support for other cores than the Arduino (boards.txs file attrribute XX.build.core) Added serial monitor version 1_2_1 Changed the lib for MAC os to a 4 architecture lib. version 1_2_0 Added Com functionality. Available Com ports are listed where you can select a com port Now all arduino boards are reset when doing an upload. adde , to the list of non allowed characters version 1_1_6 Some board names contain ( and ) which gives problems when creating the arduino project names. This has been fixed now. When importing a library the selected project is used as the default project. Error handling during import pops up now Version 1_1_5 Mac os is supported now. This means the errors have been removed and the default values should be ok. Version 1_1_3 Fixes a bug that the latest used com port is used to uload a file to arduino. Now the correct set port is used. version 1_1_2 The ARDUINO define is now built based on the version.txt file. The in eclipse define has been removed. version 1_1_1 includes better error reporting (now errors are also shown in a dialog box and not only logged in the error log. Bixes a bug when that made the referenced project corrupt when changing the arduino board. version 1_1_0 is a major change. It fixed the incompatibilities with arduino 1.0 Therfore the arduino core library is replaced by arduino board library (ths was needed due to the pins_arduino I ow use the programmer as described in boards.txt version 1_0_9 fixed unix incompatibilities version 1_0_8 fixed the ok button not enabled in preference page version 1_0_7 changed licence agreement and fixes issues import of arduino library subforder "utilities" the c perspective is now proposed when a new project is created. version 1_0_6 add import library functionality previous versions are no longer available This is a plugin build upon the avr-eclise plugin. I included the avr-eclipse source code in this feature because I had to make some changes and didn't want to wait for the next version of the avr-eclipse plugin. To avoid conflict I had to rename de .innot to it.baeyens. I kept the same ID to keep the plugins data compatible. Jan
